content: hello everyone why lock here welcome
back today I'm going to show you how I made this umber Hulk pin that you're out
of seashells sort of came together as a stream of consciousness type of thing
and I had a lot of fun with it but a disclaimer this is not cost-effective
compared to just buying a miniature like say nosers this is intended for crafters
like myself we have all this stuff lying around you can cobble something together
that's what happened here so I didn't go out and buy anything to do this oh and
one other thing a lesson learned right off the bat it's slightly too big so
pick smaller seashells this is a pouch of assorted seashells from a crafting
store should also be available at like Walmart and places like that anywhere
that might have decorative vase filler going through it I found this large one
that I thought would make a good carrot and then these smaller conch shaped ones
here's a Google image search for inspiration on a number Hulk
and I thought these shells would be good feet in hands they can be cleaned up and
modified with careful use of clippers paper clip take a paper clip and
straighten it out and then fill a shell with hot glue and secure the paper clip
in it note there's gonna be a lot of glue in there so it might take like five
solid minutes to fully cool and you gotta hold the paperclip steady on
here's a tip whenever you attach a paper clip with hot glue take some pliers and
bend the end of the clip 90 degrees what this does is when the hot glue cools it
prevents the paperclip from spinning in place because it gives you two axes of
control instead of one and maybe texture that exposed hot glue with the tip of
the hot glue gun at this point it was gonna be fidgety to
work with so I went ahead and drew my two inch circular base on some chipboard
just to help give me some reference and started a dry fit and bend the legs to
the pose I wanted the hot glue them to the carapace shell again notice bending
the ends of the paperclip 90 degrees for strength and stability it is crucial
hold everything still until the hot glue is a hundred percent cooled not just
cool to the touch it needs to be totally hardened if there's movement during that
process the connection will end up weak from there cover the paper clips with
hot glue to fill out the girth of the legs and arms in my case I've gotten
this big open area here in the carapace so rather than fill all that with hot
glue I took another small shell trimmed it to fit and hot glued it in place
Jiri is so far looking pretty good I'm going to cut out the base and attach the
feet to make this easier to work on at this point I decided instead of doing
the arms I would do the head first so that I could be sure that the shoulder
placement looks good in context here's a glass bead the kind you see filling
flower vases and stuff like that any color is fine because we're gonna go
ahead and cover it totally in hot glue and then texture up that hot glue by
using the tip of a hot glue gun for the mandibles here's a toothpick take some
pliers and partially break it every 3 or 4 millimeters or so this is easier shown
than described so you can just watch and now cover that with hot glue to
solidify the shape and give a nice gnarly texture at the same time not too
much just the bare minimum to cover up the wood all around and now remember how
we did the teeth back in episode 126 with the beholder nip the last three
millimeters or so of a toothpick use the hot glue gun to reheat the glue on the
mandible and attach the tooth with tweezers and once all the teeth are
attached again use the nozzle to kind of tease hot glue up around the base of
each tooth and really get them solidified in that hot glue then just a
small dab to attach the mandible to the head two of them to be exact and for the
eyes I used flat back rhinestones again these can be found at any crafting store
or party store then hot glue it onto the body wherever you like followed by the
arms and again bulk those up with layered beads of hot glue
finishing touches the claws take those toothpick remnants from the teeth
earlier so they're missing the sharpest point right well chopped the next
centimeter and then just like the mandible partially break it in one spot
and as before cover that with hot glue and then attach to the feet and hands
prime time I use gray krylon matte primer from here you paint them up how
you like and according to your ability in a moment I'll walk you through what I
did but first real quick the usual drama go
ahead and like this video if in fact you liked it I'd love to have you as a
subscriber and so on and so on if my stuff is useful to you and you want to
support the channel totally free consider using my Amazon affiliate link
in the video description below totally free to you I just get a small
kickback for having referred you and for all you 3d printers out there while ochs
crafting vids is sponsored by Heroes hoard which has an excellent range of
high-quality models including but not limited to Altru tiles lines which are
open lock compatible also check out my modules over on the DMS guild and
remember $3 patrons get free copies of all my releases for the base coat I'm
going to use fittingly monster Brown this is a lighter tan sort of brown into
the airbrush with a couple drops of flow improver and water
remember starter tips for airbrushing or are back in episode 90 and then fin
applications to give it a nice solid Brown
then with a bone or cream color again with the airbrush I did some zenithal
highlighting so fire at the model with the airbrush from only one direction
usually top down and don't get too trigger-happy in short order you get a
lot of detail that automatically starts to pop out alternatively you could just
do a dry brush using downward strokes only now notice this is all kind of a
light color kind of dusty that's because I knew I was about to give it a dark
brown wash whenever you gonna use a wash you should
use a brighter base color than you think appropriate cuz washes bring down the
brightness a lot so with everything nice and dry take a brown wash like GWS egg
rex earth shade or army painter strong tone and wash the entire model with it
let the detail do the work for you here it is wet it's gonna take a good full
hour to totally dry and here it is dry now I want the forearms and feet to
stand out a bit so I colored them with a rich chocolate type of brown and then
back to that bone color with a dry brush Oh a little tip I picked up watching
Vince vent Rinella on YouTube cheap makeup brushes are perfect for dry
brushing so I do the whole model to pick out highlights and at the same time
solid coverage on the claws and teeth at this point I felt it was a little too
sandstone the overall look wasn't rich enough so I took some army painter flesh
wash which is basically identical to GW Ryland flesh shade it's really just a
reddish brownish sepia and wash the entire model with it to tie everything
together once that's dry all that's left are the eyes now this thing is supposed
to cause confusion so I think the I should have a glassy hypnotic look to
them I'm gonna use three shades of green and white start by base coating the eyes
with dark green remember two thin coats then a plain green painted in a crescent
shape in the bottom right third of the eye like this and then you sort of blend
the edge into the dark green with your brush this will take some
experimentation and there's lots of great tutorials out there on blending
but basically I just do micro swipes across the edge and kind of taper it in
there and this is what you get then with lime
green just hit the very lower right curve and again kind of taper it up so
you get this and finally with plain white and your best tipped brush put a
tiny dot toward the upper-left so the intended effect is a glassy green
Hemisphere for an eye so here's some close-ups of the final product again
he's a little bit too large should he use smaller seashells oh and for the
base I just painted that straight black easy anyway you guys really seem to
respond to the ping pong ball beholder last time so I figured I would try and
do another found item miniature on that note if you have some suggestions or
ideas leave a comment below and I'll see what I can do in the future because
obviously I'm having a lot of fun with these I'm gonna go put this guy away for
next week's session if you liked this particular project here's two more that
you should go check out right now also enjoy this community showcase and don't
forget to subscribe and click that Bell reminder icon I am why lock thanks for
joining me and I'll see you next time
